ygData.subject: Re: Picbreeder Genome Complexity

Peter, I agree completely.  We are working on getting graphical
visualizati=
on of CPPNs onto Picbreeder.  We actually do have a fairly
sophisticated vi=
sualizer right now internally in our group, but it
needs to be upgraded to =
work with the latest Picbreeder code. 
Hopefully that will happen soon, bec=
ause I think it's a fantastic
educational tool.

ken

--- In neat@yahoogrou=
ps.com, "petar_chervenski" <petar_chervenski@...>
wrote:
>
> Hi Ken. Thanks=
 for adding this new feature. Now it is easier to 
> analyze genome complex=
ity vs. phenotype complexity. I know Picbreeder 
> is generally intended to=
 be a place for fun, but adding such features 
> also helps researchers to =
understand the workings of CPPNs. You know, 
> it would be cool that a whol=
e section for research purposes to exist. 
> It may contain graphical visua=
lization of the CPPNs and that thing 
> with the intermediate pictures at e=
ach hidden node. And the God mode 
> from DelphiNEAT's genetic art program,=
 too. Well it is only a 
> suggestion, in general researchers can write the=
ir own tools, but 
> Picbreeder has already a huge database of interactivel=
y evolved 
> pictures, so it would be good to be able to use that. 
> 
> Pe=
ter
> 
> --- In neat@yahoogroups.com, "Kenneth Stanley" <kstanley@> wrote:
=
> >
> > I know some people have been interested in knowing the complexity o=
f
> > CPPNs that produce different patterns on Picbreeder.  To address 
> t=
his
> > question, Picbreeder now displays the number of nodes and number of=

> > connections in every published CPPN on the site.  The detailed 
> disp=
lay
> > of any image (i.e. when you click on images that are in lists) show=
s
> > information right above the enlarged image.  
> > 
> > The most conne=
ctions I've seen just browsing around is around 500. 
> > For example, "Hab=
itable Earth" takes 477 connections to represent: 
> > http://picbreeder.or=
g/search/showgenome.php?sid=3D5776
> > 
> > However, some interesting image=
s take a lot less.  The "butterfly,"
> > for example, takes just 108: 
> > =
http://picbreeder.org/search/showgenome.php?sid=3D4376
> >

ho don't know about Picbreeder, it's front page is at

.org
